author: Anonymous Comp
title: Correct Variables For Signatures of Abstract Functions
question:
We were taught to go from X -> Y -> Z, but for more complex problems that require more than 3 variables in the signature, what convention for choosing variables would we use?

I chose to go from before X so that my variables would end in Z, is this allowed?
student_answer:
pls @6
(did you not see the past 3 get snipped)
instructor_answer: The order doesn't really matter.  I usually go X Y Z U V W, because in examples with only 3 you tend to see X Y Z.  But it doesn't really matter.
